Suppose there are two players, A and B, who are involved in a business deal. Player A can choose between investing in a risky project with a 40% chance of success or a safe project with a 80% chance of success. However, player A's effort in the project will also affect the outcome. Specifically, if player A invests in the risky project and puts forth little effort, the project will have a 10% chance of success, whereas if he puts forth a lot of effort, the project will have a 70% chance of success. Player A's effort in the safe project will not affect the outcome, which has an 80% chance of success regardless of effort.

Assume player B's effort is fixed and will not affect the outcome of the project. If player A invests in the risky project and puts forth little effort, player B will receive $1000. If player A invests in the risky project and puts forth a lot of effort, player B will receive $3000. If player A invests in the safe project, player B will receive $2000 regardless of effort.

What should player A choose to do if their utility function is U(x) = x^(1/2), where x is the amount of money they receive?
